column4: if i recall correctly, you're running gutsy. the kernel may simply have abug, so there's nothing you can do, except using a stable version
I'm actually at the stable version now, but the problem persists
what really confuses me is that it worked out of the box of Gutsy previously, but suddenly stopped. THen after a reinstall, it still didin't work
I can install e.g. Feisty using it... so the connectors must be fine
so i need to look at your dmesg
interesting, I've tried to grep for -i cd and -i samsung
thanks for spotting, now I have something to build future fix-attempts on
see line 170: try pci=assign-busses as additional boot parameters in grubs menu.lst
wonderful, looks very promising, thanks for being awesome! :D
I suspect the conflict happend because I poked in BIOS, that would explain why it suddenly stopped working, would you agree?
or does the BIOS have nothing do do with pci?
